docs.abstract: We are not having a real discussion.

docs.snippet: Kenyan and Somali soldiers killed five suspected Islamic extremist bombers attempting to cross into the country from Ethiopia in a car laden with explosives and six suicide vests, a Kenyan military spokesman said Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kenyan and Somali soldiers killed five suspected Islamic extremist bombers attempting to cross into the country from Ethiopia in a car laden with explosives and six suicide vests, a Kenyan military spokesman said Sunday.

docs.snippet: Greek bakers in the northern city of Thessaloniki have made a giant "koulouri," a ring bread similar to a bagel, around the city's most visible monument, the medieval White Tower....

headline.main: Greek Bakers Encircle Monument With Ring Bread
headline.print_headline: Greek Bakers Encircle Monument With Ring Bread

docs.lead_paragraph: Greek bakers in the northern city of Thessaloniki have made a giant "koulouri," a ring bread similar to a bagel, around the city's most visible monument, the medieval White Tower.

docs.snippet: The Spanish nurse who contracted Ebola while caring for two infected priests in a Madrid hospital, becoming the first person to contract the virus outside West Africa, appears to have overcome the deadly disease, the government said on Sunday....

headline.main: Spanish Ebola Nurse Appears Clear of Disease, Says Government
headline.print_headline: Spanish Ebola Nurse Appears Clear of Disease, Says Government

docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish nurse who contracted Ebola while caring for two infected priests in a Madrid hospital, becoming the first person to contract the virus outside West Africa, appears to have overcome the deadly disease, the government said on Sunday.

docs.snippet: French Economy Minister Emmanuel Macron said on Sunday he was sure the European Commission would not reject Paris's 2015 budget although it breaks EU deficit limits....

headline.main: France 'Totally Sure' Budget Will Win EU Approval
headline.print_headline: France 'Totally Sure' Budget Will Win EU Approval

docs.lead_paragraph: French Economy Minister Emmanuel Macron said on Sunday he was sure the European Commission would not reject Paris's 2015 budget although it breaks EU deficit limits.

docs.snippet: Liberian President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf said Ebola has killed more than 2,000 people in her country and has brought it to "a standstill," noting that Liberia and two other badly hit countries were already weakened by years of war....

headline.main: Liberia President Describes Heavy Cost of Ebola
headline.print_headline: Liberia President Describes Heavy Cost of Ebola

docs.lead_paragraph: Liberian President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf said Ebola has killed more than 2,000 people in her country and has brought it to "a standstill," noting that Liberia and two other badly hit countries were already weakened by years of war.

docs.snippet: A Spanish nursing assistant infected with Ebola after treating missionary priests with the disease repatriated from West Africa has managed to beat it after nearly two weeks of treatment in Madrid and has no traces of the virus in her bloodstream,...

headline.main: Spaniard With Ebola Beats the Disease, Test Shows
headline.print_headline: Spaniard With Ebola Beats the Disease, Test Shows

docs.lead_paragraph: A Spanish nursing assistant infected with Ebola after treating missionary priests with the disease repatriated from West Africa has managed to beat it after nearly two weeks of treatment in Madrid and has no traces of the virus in her bloodstream, according to test results released Sunday night by Spain's government.

docs.snippet: New York's Metropolitan Opera is bracing for its most tumultuous opening in decades on Monday as protesters get ready to picket "The Death of Klinghoffer," the John Adams opera about the 1985 hijacking of a cruise ship by Palestinian guerillas....

headline.main: New York's Met Opera Braces for 'Death of Klinghoffer' Protests
headline.print_headline: New York's Met Opera Braces for 'Death of Klinghoffer' Protests

docs.lead_paragraph: New York's Metropolitan Opera is bracing for its most tumultuous opening in decades on Monday as protesters get ready to picket "The Death of Klinghoffer," the John Adams opera about the 1985 hijacking of a cruise ship by Palestinian guerillas.

docs.snippet: New guidelines being developed for U.S. hospitals treating Ebola patients will be more stringent and will direct workers to make sure their skin and hair are fully covered, a top U.S. health official said Sunday....

headline.main: New Ebola Guidelines Will Be More Stringent- U.S. Health Official
headline.print_headline: New Ebola Guidelines Will Be More Stringent- U.S. Health Official

docs.lead_paragraph: New guidelines being developed for U.S. hospitals treating Ebola patients will be more stringent and will direct workers to make sure their skin and hair are fully covered, a top U.S. health official said Sunday.

docs.snippet: Swansea City manager Garry Monk risks punishment from the FA after accusing referee Michael Oliver and Stoke City winger Victor Moses of cheating in his team's 2-1 Premier League defeat at the Britannia Stadium on Sunday....

headline.main: Monk Risks FA Sanctions After Accusing Referee of Cheating
headline.print_headline: Monk Risks FA Sanctions After Accusing Referee of Cheating

docs.lead_paragraph: Swansea City manager Garry Monk risks punishment from the FA after accusing referee Michael Oliver and Stoke City winger Victor Moses of cheating in his team's 2-1 Premier League defeat at the Britannia Stadium on Sunday.
